data.meanings: to pass by, overlook, transgress, turn aside.. adwun - wickedly, unjustly, spitefully, wrongfully.. adi'yat - companies of warriors, chargers, horses of the warriors, wayfarers who run fast on their journey, swift horses.. aduwatun - enmity. udwan - hostility, injustice. aduwwan (pl. aduwun) - enemy.. . Ya'duuna (impf. 3rd. m. pl.): They transgressed; Programmed.. Laa Ta'du (prt. neg. m. sing.): Do not overlook, not let your eye turn away.. Laa Ta'duu (prt. neg. m. plu.): Do not transgress, violate.. 'Aad (act. pic. m. sing.): Transgressor; Who goes beyond the limits.. 'Aaduuna (act. pic. m. plu.): Transgressors; People who know no limits.. 'Adaytum (prf. 2nd. plu. III.): You are at enmity.. Yat'adda (imp. 3rd. m. sing. V): He trespasses, violates.. I'tadaa (prf. 3rd. m. sing. VIII): Violated.. I'tadan (prf. 3rd. m. plu. VIII.): They transgressed.. I'tadaina (prf. 1st. plu. VIII): We have transgressed.. Ya'taduuna (imp. 3rd. m. plu. VIII): They transgressed.. Ta'taduu (imp. 2nd. m. plu. acc. final Nun dropped): You transgress.. Li Ta'taduu (imp. 2nd. m. plu. el.): That you may transgress.. l'taduu (prt. m. plu.): You punish for violence, punish for transgression.. Laa Ta'taduu (prt. neg. m. plu.): You transgress not.. Mu'tadun (ap-der. m. sing.): Transgressor.. Mu'taduun / Mu'tadiin (acc. ap-der. m. sing.): Transgressor.. 'Adwan (v. n. acc.): Transgressing.. 'Aduwwun / 'Aduwwan (acc. v. n.): Enemy.. A'da'un (n. pl.): Enemies.. 'Udwaanun (v. n.): Violence; Punishment of violence; Harshness; Injustice; Transgression.. 'Adaawatun (v. n.): Enmity.. 'Udwatun (n.): Side; End.. 'Adiyaat (act. pic. f. plu.): Panting; Running; Coursers..

VIII): They transgressed.. Ta'taduu (imp. 2nd. m. plu. acc. final Nun dropped): You transgress.. Li Ta'taduu (imp. 2nd. m. plu. el.): That you may transgress.. l'taduu (prt. m. plu.): You punish for violence, punish for transgression.. Laa Ta'taduu (prt. neg. m. plu.): You transgress not.. Mu'tadun (ap-der. m. sing.): Transgressor.. Mu'taduun / Mu'tadiin (acc. ap-der. m. sing.): Transgressor.. 'Adwan (v. n. acc.): Transgressing.. 'Aduwwun / 'Aduwwan (acc. v. n.): Enemy.. A'da'un (n. pl.): Enemies.. 'Udwaanun (v. n.): Violence; Punishment of violence; Harshness; Injustice; Transgression.. 'Adaawatun (v. n.): Enmity.. 'Udwatun (n.): Side; End.. data.meanings: to say/speak, to call, to be named, word/speech, utterance, a thing said, greeting, discourse, one who says/speaks. To inspire/transmit/relate/answer/think/profess, emit an opinion on, indicate a state or condition or circumstance. qa'ilun - speaker, indicator.
data.sentence: The word فَقُلْنَا comes from the root ق و ل and is associated with the meanings: to say/speak, to call, to be named, word/speech, utterance, a thing said, greeting, discourse, one who says/speaks. To inspire/transmit/relate/answer/think/profess, emit an opinion on, indicate a state or condition or circumstance. qa'ilun - speaker, indicator.

data.meanings: veiled/concealed/covered/hid/protected (e.g. cloth, armour, grave, shield), invisible, become dark/posessed, darkness of night, bereft of reason, mad/insane/unsound in mind/intellect, confusedness.Become thick/full-grown/blossom, herbage, garden.Spiritual beings that conceal themselves from the senses (including angels), become weak and abject, greater part of mankind, devil/demon, people who are peerless having no match or equal, a being who is highly potent, sometimes refers to Kings because they are concealed from the common folk
data.sentence: The word الْجَنَّةِ comes from the root ج ن ن and is associated with the meanings: veiled/concealed/covered/hid/protected (e.g. cloth, armour, grave, shield), invisible, become dark/posessed, darkness of night, bereft of reason, mad/insane/unsound in mind/intellect, confusedness.Become thick/full-grown/blossom, herbage, garden.Spiritual beings that conceal themselves from the senses (including angels), become weak and abject, greater part of mankind, devil/demon, people who are peerless having no match or equal, a being who is highly potent, sometimes refers to Kings because they are concealed from the common folk

data.meanings: to couple/join/pair/unite/wed, marriage, a pair, a fellow or like, spouse.
data.sentence: The word وَلِزَوْجِكَ comes from the root ز و ج and is associated with the meanings: to couple/join/pair/unite/wed, marriage, a pair, a fellow or like, spouse.

data.meanings: To go out, go forth, depart, evade/escape/extricate oneself from, to quit/forsake, to rebel, to be foul or obscene, conspicuous, be clear (as in clear sky as opposed to cloudy), to resolve/explain/render, educate/discipline/train well, render a thing of two mixtures (such as two colors, black and white, or to write upon part of a tablet and leave part of it blank), make a thing to be of different kinds, contribute to a thing or cause, make an agreement, extort/extract/produce/elicit, to exclude something or someone, to vent, surpass or excel, outstrip others, be external/extrinsic/objective.
data.sentence: The word يُخْرِجَنَّكُمَا comes from the root خ ر ج and is associated with the meanings: To go out, go forth, depart, evade/escape/extricate oneself from, to quit/forsake, to rebel, to be foul or obscene, conspicuous, be clear (as in clear sky as opposed to cloudy), to resolve/explain/render, educate/discipline/train well, render a thing of two mixtures (such as two colors, black and white, or to write upon part of a tablet and leave part of it blank), make a thing to be of different kinds, contribute to a thing or cause, make an agreement, extort/extract/produce/elicit, to exclude something or someone, to vent, surpass or excel, outstrip others, be external/extrinsic/objective.
